the gameplay in general is alright it still has the awesome mechanic from RO2 but they are lazy and don't fix the BUGS and GLITCHES from RO2.
the tunnels are mostly not even placed!! because a lot of people think its Shitfield 1 or something??  the ARTY in this game is to buggy when youre in a house or tunnel you will mostly get killed by ARTY/Napalm/Gunship, the creators did a really bad job on this title.

The new FLC is quite good!! love the maps and the guns just that the main weapon for the Australian army is bad real bad (L1A1) you have more chance with killing someone with the bayonet than shooting the thing. 

SO DO NOT GET THIS GAME!! (im going back after every update to see if they made progress) they did with the general gameplay the Vietnamese in my experience win more (like they should) they are still loads of bugs. they have updated the m14 and its now actually usefull. but with the AK you still have to shoot over 10 bullets to kill someone. 
Its clear to me that the devs have the worst map desingers, you can clearly see that after the last major update. The maps are just sooo poorly designed no flanking just linear gameplay with death zones for the attackers like the map A Sau (ASS) 

The hit Registration is the worst ive seen in a long time, you often unload your whole mag into someone and still no bullet hit. What i also have noticed lately that some bullets can Pen anything, ive been killed multiple times inside a tunnel from over a 100 metres. 

For some reason the Flamer is debuffed? i have used it an entire match and it has become useless at short range,fire does less damage now apparently.

The maps are really badly designed, the main spawns are often way to open. So when there are choppers in the match youve lost pretty much. 

As of June 1st 2019, they have added a lot of new maps, creator/player ones. Which are the worst ive ever seen in any video game, the vanilla ones are even better. The guns seem to deal, barely no damage just like the grenades they are pretty much useless. The spawns are even worse on the newer maps. 

Only good thing i can say about this game is that the updates are all free, you don't see that anymore.

I got to play the beta for this game way back in 2017, and I've since logged over 300 hours of playtime. While you should know that the game is more or less done with content, the stuff that's in the game is very fantastic. While there are some bugs here and there, there's nothing I can recall that's game breaking, rather more annoying than anything else. Community is, well, it's a Red Orchestra game, so expect the drudges of human society to show up. Overall, I'd say this game is an 8/10.

However, one thing I should note is that mod support is a little scuffed at the moment; essentially, servers cannot run stuff like the Winter War mod and the Gameplay Overhaul Mutator, without the server being unranked. So don't go into this expecting to play mods, at least for now.
"Anti-Ass defenses are active!"

Bugged server menu (spamms connecting to random servers and can't stop it), bugged weapons (can't aim down sight or shoot, dshk disappearing when you die), bugged movement ( jumping over an object and going back, or lagging after you go prone), the game is not worth 20 euros nor are the people behind it. Can't deliver a product in conditions.

Bugs, bugs, BUGS. Janky as all fuck, for god knows how many years this has been out. Your character will get caught on the terrain, randomly lower their weapon, or get stuck and vibrate on the spot - going prone is especially bad for this, it's like playing the lottery. Select a grenade, wait no it didn't work, try again, nope, try again, ok now it's out, now I'm dead. Or better yet, throw it, but don't actually throw it, only to throw it at your feet/a wall/your teammates. Devs would rather release cosmetic DLC than un-fuck the game, and now have just abandoned. 

Many of the maps are just bad but will be picked over and over again *cough Resort and Cu-Chi cough* by the braindead community. The winning condition is convoluted as fuck - you'll be playing a game where you're ok for time, doing well on objectives, then suddenly run out of tickets, with the enemy team still having well over a hundred. Or you'll have tickets but run out of time. Or get locked out of capture point, which is on yet another timer. Moreover, playing on the objective isn't nearly incentivized enough, resulting in people going off into the bush to look for kills, then acting surprised when they lose all the points.

Community is terrible too, if you happen to be one of the actually fun roles to play, like pilot or sniper, you'll invariably get kicked because someone else wants to play that role. To add insult to injury, you can't even rejoin the same server for a while, you'll get a connection time out error. Only on League of Legends have I played with bigger shitheads.

I've put a lot of time into the game and was I really enjoying this game? or missing RO2? I have to say it seems more of the latter. This game is filled to the brim with some of the most annoying issues and the Devs just abandoned it. Having to reload twice to be able to shoot again, having to throw the same grenade twice just to get it off once, RPGs used as anti infantry instead of anti helicopter, bipods in general, how all the maps boil down to being trees and bushes as the best cover because of RPGs. They promised land vehicles but none came. I would not recommend buying it at this time, the only thing I really enjoy about this game is the game mode campaign, and that more so because of RO2 than anything to do with this game.

The game is pretty good, the concept is decent, a solid tactical shooter squad based game with a commander role with abilities, i cant say any bad things about the game except the outdated graphics and need for some optimization which clearly by now more than 3 years the developers abandoned the game, other than that the game is good.

HOWEVER; the player base is just ruining the game, most of the players are acting like call of duty players in a tactical game; rushing the map jumping like crazies and have 0 communication or commitment for team play and to squad leaders commands, which the game was created for !! 

Also i need to mention the roles being picked by player due to their computer power and connection speed to be faster in loading the map, so good luck getting any good class.

Reference to all that, unfortunately i cant recommend this good game due to its player base.

I have had problems starting the game. sometimes it crashes on startup and sometimes steam seemingly doesn't want to even try running it. Every time it crashes i have to restart my PC in order to be able to try starting the game again. if it fails, you go for another restart.

I have managed to play a few minutes of gameplay however. I'm a Battlefield player at heart and so the gameplay translates well to me. that said, it's horribly optimized. My PC exceedes minimum requirements in all aspects, some more than others, yet even at lowest graphics i can't get a stable 50 fps. and the graphics at lowest look horrendous. Like, just cause 2 level of terribleness, from a game that came out 10 years after that one.

I have looked for solutions for the crashing online but haven't been able to find a fix. As far as i can tell everyone is having crashing problems, just that some experience them more than others.

I might try the game when i have a better PC, but for now this is a refund and a hard 'don't recommend' from me.

Do you know what the M-97 Flamethrower sounds like? It roars like a dragon, a fiery god purging everything in it's path. Hold down the trigger and the "woosh" drowns out everything else, focus on the noise and you almost convince yourself you don't hear the screams. By the time the tank is empty, everything is over, even the men are quiet. There's nothing but the crackling of burning thatch. You see, it's not the noise that keeps me awake at night, it's the silence.

Perfect balance of realism and arcade that makes all encounters intense, multiplayer campaign is by far the best I've have ever played in any FPS the ability to choose where to fight and which army to fight with makes every campaign feel different and fresh, class system fits perfectly with each class having strengths and weakness and with no one class outshining the others.

"DU MA MAY!" SAID A BUSH

A followed a man with an M16 playing Kansas' entire discography across what seemed like an endless rice paddy. Then a man named Charles started singing along. We heard his accent. We killed him. Nice Game!

PROS
-A perfect blend of realism and fast paced arcade like action
-Adrenaline pumping, epic 64 player battles that often come down to the last man standing
-Proximity chat for added interaction with allies/enemies
-Flyable helicopters with mostly realistic flight controls
-Tons of weapons
-ARVN (South Vietnamese) and Australian forces available
-Victory is extremely rewarding
-Lots and lots of napalm

CONS
-Developer support ended in 2019
-Still a few bugs and glitches present
-Steep learning curve
-Repeated deaths/defeats will have you nerd raging in no time
-Lots and lots of napalm

I would Highly recommend this to the friends. RS2 is a tactical shooter. Tactical shooters can have a low Time To Kill, and the chances of survival in those types of games are fairly slim (which makes this game so realistic). RS2 is realistic in ways that its fairly similar to Vietnam. Some of the maps are based off of real life battlefields. Rs2 is a great game. After playing this game playing other games just does not feel the same. I rate this 5 out of 5.
